New Records: The unbroken 72-run ninth-wicket partnership set a record for a game involving a full ICC member.
Akeal Hosein (44 off 16, 3 x 4, 4 x 6) and Romario Shepherd (44 off 28, 1 x 4, 5 x 6) both posted new personal high scores.
Key Match Events: England won by one run to level the Betway Series 1-1.
Akeal Hosein scored 26 runs in the final over, including three 6s and two 4s.
Reece Topley trapped Brandon King lbw and ran out Shai Hope.
Moeen Ali took 3 wickets for 24 runs and was named Man-of-the-Match.
Jason Roy scored 45 runs and Moeen Ali scored 31 runs for England.
Nicholas Pooran and Darren Bravo put on 41 runs for the third wicket for West Indies.
West Indies were 65 for 7 at one point, needing 73 runs from 29 balls.
Hosein and Shepherd's partnership brought West Indies close to victory.
Post-Match Reflections: West Indies captain Kieron Pollard praised the team's fight at the back end and highlighted the confidence of Akeal Hosein and Romario Shepherd.
England captain Eoin Morgan expressed delight with the game, emphasizing the importance of playing tight games to work on death hitting and death bowling.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Kensington Oval in Bridgetown, Barbados.
West Indies captain Kieron Pollard won the toss and elected to field.
England's strategy involved testing the patience of the West Indies batsmen with a rhythm of 'dot, dot, dot, wicket, boundary'.
